Add a CSS class to a element.

Handles multiple space-separated classes for legacy reasons.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[createSvgElement(name, attrs, opt\_parent)](./blockly.utils_namespace.dom_namespace.createsvgelement_1_function.md)


</td><td>

Helper method for creating SVG elements.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[getFastTextWidth(textElement, fontSize, fontWeight, fontFamily)](./blockly.utils_namespace.dom_namespace.getfasttextwidth_1_function.md)


</td><td>

Gets the width of a text element using a faster method than `getTextWidth`<!-- -->. This method requires that we know the text element's font family and size in advance. Similar to `getTextWidth`<!-- -->, we cache the width we compute.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[getFastTextWidthWithSizeString(textElement, fontSize, fontWeight, fontFamily)](./blockly.utils_namespace.dom_namespace.getfasttextwidthwithsizestring_1_function.md)


</td><td>

Gets the width of a text element using a faster method than `getTextWidth`<!-- -->. This method requires that we know the text element's font family and size in advance. Similar to `getTextWidth`<!-- -->, we cache the width we compute. This method is similar to `getFastTextWidth` but expects the font size parameter to be a string.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[getTextWidth(textElement)](./blockly.utils_namespace.dom_namespace.gettextwidth_1_function.md)


</td><td>

Gets the width of a text element, caching it in the process.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[hasClass(element, className)](./blockly.utils_namespace.dom_namespace.hasclass_1_function.md)


</td><td>

Checks if an element has the specified CSS class.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[insertAfter(newNode, refNode)](./blockly.utils_namespace.dom_namespace.insertafter_1_function.md)


</td><td>

Insert a node after a reference node. Contrast with node.insertBefore function.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[measureFontMetrics(text, fontSize, fontWeight, fontFamily)](./blockly.utils_namespace.dom_namespace.measurefontmetrics_1_function.md)


</td><td>

Measure a font's metrics. The height and baseline values.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[removeClass(element, className)](./blockly.utils_namespace.dom_namespace.removeclass_1_function.md)


</td><td>

Remove a CSS class from a element.

Handles multiple space-separated classes for legacy reasons.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[removeClasses(element, classNames)](./blockly.utils_namespace.dom_namespace.removeclasses_1_function.md)


</td><td>

Removes multiple classes from an element.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[removeNode(node)](./blockly.utils_namespace.dom_namespace.removenode_1_function.md)


</td><td>

Removes a node from its parent. No-op if not attached to a parent.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[setCssTransform(element, transform)](./blockly.utils_namespace.dom_namespace.setcsstransform_1_function.md)


</td><td>

Sets the CSS transform property on an element. This function sets the non-vendor-prefixed and vendor-prefixed versions for backwards compatibility with older browsers. See https://caniuse.com/\#feat=transforms2d


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[startTextWidthCache()](./blockly.utils_namespace.dom_namespace.starttextwidthcache_1_function.md)


</td><td>

Start caching text widths. Every call to this function MUST also call stopTextWidthCache. Caches must not survive between execution threads.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[stopTextWidthCache()](./blockly.utils_namespace.dom_namespace.stoptextwidthcache_1_function.md)


</td><td>

Stop caching field widths. Unless caching was already on when the corresponding call to startTextWidthCache was made.


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>
